scenarioDescription:
The HD 332231 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 332231 is a star with 1.13 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.28 times its radius. It is located 263.10 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 4.3 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 332231 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 332231 system


HD 332231 b

HD 332231 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2020-05, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.14 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 332231 b is 77.592 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 332231 b is 9.718 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 332231 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 332231, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
name: HD 332231 - System With 1 Exoplanet
